intro.title: Your Personalized Coping Toolkit
intro.description: Different SUDS levels need different strategies. Build your personalized plan by choosing skills that work best for you at each intensity level.

sudsLevels.label: Mild Distress
sudsLevels.description: Manageable discomfort, good time for prevention.

skills.title: Deep Breathing
skills.description: Slow, controlled breathing to calm the nervous system

skills.title: Here & Now
skills.description: Use Mindful Observation to focus on the moment

skills.title: Self-Care (PLEASE)
skills.description: Ensure you are taking care of yourself

skills.title: STOP Skill
skills.description: Stop, Take a breath, Observe, Proceed mindfully

skills.title: Distraction Activities
skills.description: Engage in activities that shift your focus

skills.title: Problem Solving
skills.description: Use problem solving to address any challenges with clarity and intention

skills.title: TIPP Skills
skills.description: Temperature, Intense exercise, Paced breathing, Paired muscle relaxation

skills.title: Different Action
skills.description: Act opposite to your emotional urges

skills.title: Crisis Support
skills.description: Open the 'Crisis Support' page to reach out for help

skills.title: Crisis Survival
skills.description: Use your favorite distress tolerance skills like TIPP or Different Action

howToUse.title: How to Use Your Plan
instructions: Choose skills from the matching category
Try 2-3 skills before moving to higher intensity
Click "Learn more" to practice any skill
Edit your plan as you discover what works
